p: In this study, we focus on WNV, a single-stranded RNA Flavivirus closely related to other Flaviviridae pathogens such as dengue, Japanese encephalitis and yellow fever viruses [14]. Although WNV is a zoonotic pathogen, infecting mammals, particularly humans and horses, the transmission cycle is believed to be driven mainly by mosquitoes and birds [15], although some wild mammals may serve as intermediate hosts for West Nile virus [16].
